name: From Attic to Zaddik Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means very cold?
questions.explanation:
arctic.

	Or attic, antic, or antiseptic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means a building used to house soldiers?
questions.explanation:
barrack.

	Or bannock (flat bread).

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means brief or mysterious?
questions.explanation:
cryptic.

	Or Chuck or click or cluck.

questions.text: The male _______ is called a drake.
questions.explanation:
duck.

	Or Dick Tracy or dybbuk.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means having to do with financial matters?
questions.explanation:
economic.

	Or electric, elliptic, or emetic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means marked by fast, anxious activity?
questions.explanation:
frantic & frenetic.

	Or the Frick Art Center, or flick, or forensic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, and starting with G, could complete the phrase _____ design?
questions.explanation:
graphic.

	Or galvanic or garlic or generic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means a kind of fish?
questions.explanation:
haddock.

	Or hammock or hassock or Huck Finn.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means carefree, as in an _______ afternoon?
questions.explanation:
idyllic.

	Or intrinsic or illogic.

questions.text: I'm skipping J--all I could find was "juridic." So, what word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, begins with K and fits this clue: I get a _______ out of you?
questions.explanation:
kick.

	As the Cole Porter song goes, "I get no kick from champagne...cocaine...a plane...but I get a kick out of you!"

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, is the name of a town in Texas?
questions.explanation:
Lubbock & Luchenbach.

	Lubbock is located south of Amarillo. It's at the junction between the panhandle and the pan. Other words: lick, luck, and lyric.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, is an antiquated word for a digging tool similar to a pickax?
questions.explanation:
mattock.

	Or manic, muck, or Mick Jagger.

questions.text: Here's a freebie: Jolly old Saint _______.  What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, fits in the blank?
questions.explanation:
Nick.

	Or Nick Nolte or Nick Cage or knickknack.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means related to vision or the eye, as in _______ nerve?
questions.explanation:
optic.

	Or operatic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, is the surname of the artist Jackson _______?
questions.explanation:
Pollock.

	Jackson Pollock, 1912-1956, was a leading Abstract Expressionist painter. Other words: pick, Puck (in "A Midsummer Night's Dream"), and pathetic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means an antonym for "sluggish"?
questions.explanation:
quick.

	Or quixotic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means a country bumpkin?
questions.explanation:
rustic.

	Or Rick Moranis, rick (to pile up hay) or ruck (to wrinkle).

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, is a synonym for "ailing"?
questions.explanation:
sick.

	Or shuck or Semitic or solipsistic.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means a bloodsucking arachnid?
questions.explanation:
tick.

	Or the book "Tuck Everlasting" or topic or triptych.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, is an antonym for "congenial."
questions.explanation:
unsympathetic.

	Or unpoetic.

questions.text: What word, starting with V ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, completes this phrase: The Old _______?
questions.explanation:
Vic.

	The Old Vic is one of the oldest theaters (theatres) in London.

questions.text: What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, is the name of a famous English castle now owned by Tussaud's?
questions.explanation:
Warwick.

	Several monarchs, included Elizabeth I and Victoria, visited Warwick Castle, which dates back to the time of William the Conqueror. There are beautiful gardens there, as well as deep dungeons and soaring towers.

questions.text: Get out your Scrabble dictionaries, players. What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, means yellowish?
questions.explanation:
xanthic.

	Well, it was between that and "xeric", which means "requiring only a little water".

questions.text: Alas, poor _______! What word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound, completes this phrase?
questions.explanation:
Yorick.

	"Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio." Yorick was a playful courtier whom Hamlet knew in boyhood. Hamlet finds his bones and remembers him fondly.

questions.text: You can get this one from the quiz title: In Judaism, a saintly, religious person or the leader of an Hassidic community is described by what word, ending with an "ick" or "uck" sound?
questions.explanation:
zaddik.

	Also spelled "tzaddik," this word comes from Hebrew. In Potok's novel "The Chosen," Danny's dad is a tzaddik.
